required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Meningococcal ACWY Immune Response in Children Aged 40 and 60 Months
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-label, Controlled, Multi-center Study to Evaluate Meningococcal ACWY Antibody Response in Children Aged 40 and 60 Months Who Have Previously Received Novartis MenACWY Conjugate Vaccine as Infants

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate how well the immuno response against meningococcal serogroups A, C, W and Y lasts in children who were vaccinated with MenACWY as infants.

primary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects with human Serum Bactericidal Assay (hSBA) ≥1:8 as measured by serum bactericidal activity at 40 months and 60 months of age and associated 95% Clopper-Pearson CIs were computed for each of the serogroups within each of the vaccinated groups and in age-matched control subjects.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentages of subjects with hSBA ≥1:4 as measured by serum bactericidal activity at 40 months and 60 months of age and associated 95% Clopper-Pearson CIs were computed for each of the serogroups within each of the vaccinated groups and in age-matched control subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: GMTs in Subjects Within Each Site and in Age-Matched Control Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: The Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) as measured by serum bactericidal activity at 40 months and 60 months of age and 95% CIs were calculated for each vaccine group and for each serogroup by exponentiating (base 10) the least square means of the logarithmically transformed (base 10) titers and their 95% CIs obtained from a two-way Analysis of Variance (ANOVA) with factors for vaccine group and center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Follow-on, healthy 40, 60 months old participants who have completed the V59P5 study and are in good health
- Control subjects: healthy 60 months old who had received a complete MenC immunization course
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with any serious, acute or chronic progressive disease

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at 3 sites (1 site in the UK and 2 sites in Canada).

group.title: UK Site
group.description: UK vaccine group that received primary vaccine schedule of MenACWY (adjuvanted and unadjuvanted) vaccine at 2, 3 and 4 months with booster at 12 months of age, enrolled at either 40 or 60 months of age into the current study as follow-on participants.

group.title: UK Control
group.description: Newly enrolled age-matched subjects that received a complete vaccination course of routine monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine at 2, 3 and 4 months of age without any booster vaccination.

group.title: Canada Sites
group.description: Canadian vaccine group that received primary vaccination with MenACWY (adjuvanted and unadjuvanted) vaccine at 2,4 months of age with 12 month booster or at 2, 4, 6 months with or without a booster vaccination.

group.title: Canada Control
group.description: Newly enrolled age-matched subjects that received the complete vaccination course of routine monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine at 2 and 12 months or only at 12 months of age.

group.title: UK2,3,4,12+
group.description: UK vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 2, 3, and 4 months of age followed by a booster dose of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 12 months of age.

group.title: UK2,4,12+
group.description: UK vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a booster dose of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 12 months of age.

group.title: UK2,4C/12+
group.description: UK vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of monovalent MenC-CRM197 conjugate vaccine (Menjugate) at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a booster dose of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 12 months of age.

group.title: UK2,4,12-
group.description: UK vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine without adjuvant at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a booster dose of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine without adjuvant at 12 months of age.

group.title: UK Control
group.description: Newly enrolled age-matched subjects that received a complete vaccination course of routine monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine at 2, 3 and 4 months of age without any booster vaccination.

group.title: Ca2,4,6+
group.description: Canadian vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 2, 4 and 6 months of age without any booster vaccination.

group.title: Ca2,4,6+/12PS
group.description: Canadian vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 2, 4 and 6 months of age followed by a reduced booster vaccination of quadrivalent MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine (Menomune [1/5 dose]) at 12 months of age

group.title: Ca2,4,12+
group.description: Canadian vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a booster dose of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 12 months of age.

group.title: Ca2,4+/12PS
group.description: Canadian vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine with adjuvant at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a reduced booster vaccination of quadrivalent MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine (Menomune [1/5 dose]) at 12 months of age.

group.title: Ca2,4,12-
group.description: Canadian vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine without adjuvant at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a booster vaccination of the quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine without adjuvant at 12 months of age.

group.title: Ca2,4-/12PS
group.description: Canadian vaccine group receiving primary vaccine of quadrivalent MenACWY-CRM197 conjugate vaccine without adjuvant at 2 and 4 months of age followed by a reduced booster vaccination of the quadrivalent MenACWY polysaccharide vaccine (Menomune [1/5 dose]) at 12 months of age.

group.title: Ca Control
group.description: Newly enrolled age-matched subjects that received a complete vaccination course of routine monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine at 2 and 12 months or only at 12 months of age.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects With hSBA ≥1:8
outcome.description: Percentages of subjects with human Serum Bactericidal Assay (hSBA) ≥1:8 as measured by serum bactericidal activity at 40 months and 60 months of age and associated 95% Clopper-Pearson CIs were computed for each of the serogroups within each of the vaccinated groups and in age-matched control subjects.
outcome.population: Immunogenicity was evaluated in the Modified Intent To Treat (MITT) population that included subjects who provided at least one evaluable blood sample. Thus, the difference in the number of subjects entered here versus the number of subjects in the participant flow and baseline characteristics (i.e., enrolled subjects) module.

measure.description: Percentages of subjects with human Serum Bactericidal Assay (hSBA) ≥1:8 as measured by serum bactericidal activity at 40 months and 60 months of age and associated 95% Clopper-Pearson CIs were computed for each of the serogroups within each of the vaccinated groups and in age-matched control subjects.

reported_events.time_frame: Approximately 37 months overall (11 months of enrollment and 26 months of individual subject participation).
reported_events.desc: The analyses for serious adverse events (SAEs) and adverse events (AEs) were done on the safety population (i.e., all subjects enrolled who received study vaccination and provided post-baseline safety data).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
